attributes.action: Put forward a law to penalise buyers of a property that pull out after expenses have been incurred by the seller (as in Scotland)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: My wife and I are pensioners (both over 70) and have attempted to downsize by selling our property and buying a smaller smaller one. TWICE we have suffered from a buyer pulling out at the last moment. (after solicitors fees, surveyors fees, HIPs have been incurred) Why can we not have a system as in Scotland where once you agree to a purchase you are legally obliged to go through with it or suffer costs?
